title: 2023 McLaren GT at No Reserve
description: This 2023 McLaren GT is finished in Nerello Red, and power comes from a twin-turbocharged 4.0L V8 mated to a seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle. The car rides on Tungsten staggered-diameter forged alloy wheels and is further equipped with a double-wishbone independent suspension, adaptive dampers, carbon-ceramic brakes, dihedral doors, an electrochromic glass roof, and a rearview camera. Inside, bolstered Luxe seats trimmed in Vintage Tan leather are joined by a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation, a Bowers & Wilkins sound system, dual-zone climate control, and cruise control. This McLaren GT is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with a window sticker, two keys, a battery charger, McLaren accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 2023 McLaren GT at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #171,420.
text: This 2023 McLaren GT is finished in Nerello Red, and power comes from a twin-turbocharged 4.0L V8 mated to a seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle. The car rides on Tungsten staggered-diameter forged alloy wheels and is further equipped with a double-wishbone independent suspension, adaptive dampers, carbon-ceramic brakes, dihedral doors, an electrochromic glass roof, and a rearview camera. Inside, bolstered Luxe seats trimmed in Vintage Tan leather are joined by a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation, a Bowers & Wilkins sound system, dual-zone climate control, and cruise control. This McLaren GT is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with a window sticker, two keys, a battery charger, McLaren accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title. Sharing underpinnings with the 720S, the GT was designed as a grand tourer and featured an additional storage compartment behind the occupants. This example is finished in Nerello Red with with an electrochromic glass roof, LED lighting, dihedral doors, a rearview camera, and front and rear parking sensors. Close-up images detailing lighting, badging, and trim are provided in the gallery. Tungsten 20″ and 21″ forged alloy wheels are mounted with 225/35 front and 295/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. The car is equipped with a double-wishbone suspension, McLaren Adaptive Damping, and McLaren black-finished calipers over optional cross-drilled carbon-ceramic rotors at all four corners. The bolstered Luxe seats are trimmed in Vintage Tan leather which extends to the dashboard and door panels. Amenities include parking sensors and a rear parking camera, dual-zone climate control, a luggage retention strap, McLaren-branded floor mats, and a Bowers & Wilkins sound system linked to a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation and Bluetooth connectivity. The leather-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with paddle shifters and fronts a configurable LCD screen that displays readouts for speed, engine RPMs, and other telemetric data. The digital odometer indicates 248 miles, a handful of which have been added by the selling dealer. The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 4.0L M840T V8 is mounted beneath the cargo area and was factory rated at 612 horsepower with 465 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle. An optional sports exhaust is fitted. Additional underside photos are presented in the gallery. The window sticker lists initial delivery to McLaren Scottsdale of Scottsdale, Arizona, along with factory colors, standard equipment, options, and a total suggested retail price of $232,708. The Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 2023 McLaren GT is finished in Nerello Red, and power comes from a twin-turbocharged 4.0L V8 mated to a seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle. The car rides on Tungsten staggered-diameter forged alloy wheels and is further equipped with a double-wishbone independent suspension, adaptive dampers, carbon-ceramic brakes, dihedral doors, an electrochromic glass roof, and a rearview camera. Inside, bolstered Luxe seats trimmed in Vintage Tan leather are joined by a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation, a Bowers & Wilkins sound system, dual-zone climate control, and cruise control. This McLaren GT is now offered at no reserve by the selling dealer with a window sticker, two keys, a battery charger, McLaren accessories, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.

Sharing underpinnings with the 720S, the GT was designed as a grand tourer and featured an additional storage compartment behind the occupants. This example is finished in Nerello Red with with an electrochromic glass roof, LED lighting, dihedral doors, a rearview camera, and front and rear parking sensors. Close-up images detailing lighting, badging, and trim are provided in the gallery.

Tungsten 20″ and 21″ forged alloy wheels are mounted with 225/35 front and 295/30 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. The car is equipped with a double-wishbone suspension, McLaren Adaptive Damping, and McLaren black-finished calipers over optional cross-drilled carbon-ceramic rotors at all four corners.

The bolstered Luxe seats are trimmed in Vintage Tan leather which extends to the dashboard and door panels. Amenities include parking sensors and a rear parking camera, dual-zone climate control, a luggage retention strap, McLaren-branded floor mats, and a Bowers & Wilkins sound system linked to a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation and Bluetooth connectivity.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with paddle shifters and fronts a configurable LCD screen that displays readouts for speed, engine RPMs, and other telemetric data. The digital odometer indicates 248 miles, a handful of which have been added by the selling dealer.

The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 4.0L M840T V8 is mounted beneath the cargo area and was factory rated at 612 horsepower with 465 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle. An optional sports exhaust is fitted.

Additional underside photos are presented in the gallery.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to McLaren Scottsdale of Scottsdale, Arizona, along with factory colors, standard equipment, options, and a total suggested retail price of $232,708.

The Carfax report shows no history of accidents or other damage.
